info.text: It's a blob of animated slime, possibly from an adventurer's armpit.
If you thought this was just a regular blob of animated slime then you're in for a shock.
The kleptoblobby likes to get ahold of everything it can get its hands(?) on.
It's a particularly revolting blob of animated slime.
It's a very tough blob of animated slime, the sort of which collects around the drainpipes of gym showers.
It's a very hot blob of animated slime.
It's a blob of death and despair, in slime form. It has a corrupting effect on any weapons and armour it touches.
It's an oily blob of animated slime.
It's a very tough blob of animated slime, the sort of which collects around the drainpipes of gym showers.
Your very own slime. Sometimes drops clouds of toxic spores.
A strange little bird-thing that tunnels through walls with its odd, rubbery nasal appliance.
A strange little bird-thing that tunnels through walls with its odd, rubbery nasal appliance. This one looks like it has some kind of disease.
A strange little bird-thing that tunnels through walls with its odd, rubbery nasal appliance. This one looks really mad.
The secret leaders of Diggle society. (Such as it is.)
The fearsome Diggle Commando sneaks through the dungeons, being all it can be.
It's so hungry. So very, VERY hungry.
It hatesh you sho much... *hic*
A strange little bird-thing that tunnels through walls with its odd, rubbery nasal appliance. This one has been trained to hunt with absolute loyalty. Well, some loyalty. Mostly.
An infernal little diggle, burning with infernal little diggle rage.
Trapped in Diggle form, he wanders the Dungeons looking for revenge.
Spell-casting cephalopods with a taste for human brains. Make calamari out of them.
A wizard who sought too greedily for magical power. Transformed into a cephalopod, he vainly seeks a cure for his curse.
The remains of one of your predecessors, restored to life by the evil magic of Lord Dredmor and sent out to kill more adventurers.
A terrifying phantasmal reaper with a menacing scythe.
A terrifying phantasmal reaper with a menacing scythe and a couple of missing umlauts.
All shall know the darkness of the tomb!
The Djinns like to inhabit small, attractive glass vessels, like gin bottles, because they think it's slimming.
The Djinn Fizz likes to blow things up. It's not a complicated thinker.
The Djinn likes to inhabit small, attractive glass vessels, like gin bottles, because they think it's slimming.
It's a bat! It flaps! It has teeth.
It's a bat! It flaps! It has teeth.
It's a bat! It flaps! It has teeth. This one randomly teleports when the mood takes it.
These are Thrusties. They love to thrust; in thrust they trust, and thrust they must.
The Creep-Creep wanders through the Dungeon, not taking a hint.
A misanthropic jack-o-lantern on a scarecrow's body.
Do not question its existence! All shall tremble and fall!
Something has gone terribly wrong deep inside this vegetative horror.
A vicious, man-eating creature from the deep. How it wound up in the Dungeon is anyone's guess.
A mysterious tribal shaman in a giant wooden mask. Beware of his terrifying curses!
A dark enchanter who hides behind an enormous wooden mask. Beware of his dire magic!
Who is this mysterious stranger behind the mask - and why is he such a nuisance?
He does that Voodoo that you do so well.
As the name implies, they travel in swarms. Brutal, adventurer-destroying swarms.
A vaguely loyal demonic minion from the demonic bits of the Realm of Minions.
What happens when good spores go bad.
Your very own Mushroom Beast. Sometimes drops clouds of toxic spores.
I'm sorry, but your love interest is in another dungeon.
A man-eating carrot. Not to be confused with a man eating carrot. Zomg! The tables have turned!
A man-eating carrot. Not to be confused with a man eating carrot. This one is young and crisp.
A man-eating carrot. Not to be confused with a man eating carrot. This one looks rather cold.
A man-eating carrot. Not to be confused with a man eating carrot. This one looks over-hot.
A man-eating carrot. Not to be confused with a man eating carrot. This one looks decidedly evil.
A thin sheen of ice covers this golem.
A sheath of flame wreathes this golem.
This golem is formed from highly unpleasant poisons.
This golem is made of impure magicks. Be wary, for its touch may harm magical items.
This golem is most often found lurking around saunas and is a traditional enemy of the Finns. It is well known for operating on a timescale beyond the ken of mundane beings such as yourself.
This golem is fabulously blinged out.
The constant lack of feeling in its tentacles has made this Squiddy ill-tempered. Beware its blinding ink attacks!
Nobody's entirely sure how this demon manages to kill adventurers. But it does.
The Grandpa Mustache: a pinnacle of wisdom and experience in the Mustache Community.
These strange, brick-shaped creatures have a Mysterious Growing Moustache Attack.
This hardened veteran of the Mustache Fighting League has been training its entire life to face you in melee.
It's an animated mustache which will serve you until death.
A fire-breathing dragon.
A snow-breathing dragonling.
A magic-breathing dragonling. Beware, for its magic breath can corrupt magical items.
This fire-breathing drake is sooo cute.
It's a big, red, demon. It likes lifting weights. Like adventurers.
It's a big, blue, demon. It likes lifting weights. Like adventurers.
It's a Dread Collector. It likes pulverizing things, and it hates Criminal Scum like you.
These little green men wander around the Dungeons of Dredmor looking for pots of gold, bottles of Guinness, and heroes to rob.
These little invisible men wander around the Dungeons of Dredmor looking for pots of gold, bottles of Guinness, and heroes to rob.
As robots go, this one is a basic model. It has shiny blades, though.
This shows the tangible threat of the Unfriendly AI problem.
This robot has some kind of malevolent inner life.
The ultimate communist machine, Flint Ultrasparc only turns right by performing an inversion function on its Turn Left sequence.
A terrifying sorcerer, who sought to defy death by means of his powerful magic. Now, trapped in the Dungeon, he seeks to turn the world to dust. Evil dust.
A villainous Salesdemon with a terrible checkered suit. He will sell you the equipment that you need for your quest, but he does not take to shoplifters.
